column1: Your doctor may order a D-dimer test if you are showing symptoms of blood clots, such as: - Deep vein thrombosis (DVT): a blood clot is deep inside your leg - Leg pain - Leg swelling - Leg is hot to the touch - Color changes in your leg - Pulmonary embolism (PE): a blockage of an artery in the lungs by fat, air, a blood clot, or tumor cells - Sudden trouble breathing - Sharp pain in chest - Coughing - Coughing up blood - Fast heart beating - Disseminated intravascular coagulation (DIC): many small blood clots and serious bleeding - Bleeding gums - Nausea and vomiting - Seizures - Decreased urine - Severe stomach pain - Severe muscle pain Your doctor may also use the D-dimer test to see if treatment for DIC is working.
